channel.title: JapanesePod101.com
channel.description: Learn Japanese with Daily Podcasts from Tokyo Whether you are Japan-bound or a seasoned speaker, our lessons offer something for everyone. We incorporate culture and current issues into each episode to give the most informative, both linguistically and culturally, podcasts possible. For those of you with just the plane ride to prepare, check our survival phrase series at Japanesepod101.com. One of these phrases just might turn your trip into the best one ever! Yoroshiku O-negai Shimasu!

item.title: JLPT S2 #8 - New JLPT N4 Prep Course #8
item.description: Learn Japanese with JapanesePod101.com! You arrive home to your roommate intently completing seek-and-find puzzles in Japanese. You ask your roommate in Japanese, “I thought you were going to study all day…what are you doing playing games?” Your roommate responds in Japanese, “This is serious business! I read that I have to be able to find [...]

item.title: Japanese for Everyday Life Lower Intermediate #19 - Politely Declining a Friend’s Offer
item.description: Learn everyday Japanese conversation with JapanesePod101.com! It’s summer, and your Japanese friends are heading away for a surfing weekend. They’ve invited you several times, but you tried surfing once and it wasn’t your thing, so you keep palming them off. You just need to think of a good reason for not being able to go [...]

item.title: News #219 - You Got Us to the 300 Million Download Milestone! Now, We’d Like to Thank You!

item.title: Top 25 Japanese Questions You Need to Know #18 - What are you doing? in Japanese
item.description: Learn Japanese with JapanesePod101.com! It’s a lazy Saturday afternoon in Japan and you’re at home reading a Japanese book. item.title: Lower Intermediate Lesson #46 - Mothers’ Talk
item.description: Learn Japanese at JapanesePod101.com! What’s the matter with kids today? Two mothers bump into each other at an elementary school open house. Immediately they begin talking about how wonderful each other’s child is… at the expense of their own! Our grammar points are shika… nai and ~to kitara. After listening, [...]

item.title: Japanese for Everyday Life Lower Intermediate #18 - Inviting Your Coworker to a Movie
item.description: Learn everyday Japanese conversation with JapanesePod101.com! You’ve gathered together a group of your Japanese coworkers to see a movie on a Friday night. You’re all on your way out when you notice the new receptionist is still working. You totally forgot to invite her! But it’s not too late—maybe she doesn’t have plans and would [...]

item.title: Newbie Lesson S2 #15 - Nihongo Dōjō - This Is Just Your Cup of Japanese Tea!!
item.description: Learn Japanese with JapanesePod101.com! “Would you like some tea?” “Yes, thanks.” Drink of any kind seems to be one of the best social lubricants anywhere. In Japan, it’s no different. Customers, supervisors, employees, friends, and family in Japan all seem to speak more freely with a glass of liquid in hand. And the most frequent [...]

item.title: Top 25 Japanese Questions You Need to Know #17 - What time is it? in Japanese
item.description: Learn Japanese with JapanesePod101.com! You love your new job in Japan but you don’t love waking up early quite as much. You’ve just woken up feeling rested and refreshed…but that doesn’t seem right on a work day. Oh no! Did you sleep through your alarm? In this lesson, you will learn the question What time is [...]

item.title: Japanese Culture Class #15 - Golden Week
item.description: Learn Japanese and about Japanese culture with JapanesePod101.com. Today starts the vacation that everyone has been waiting for since the New Year vacation. item.title: Japanese for Everyday Life Lower Intermediate #17 - Telling a Real Estate Agent What Kind of Room You’d Like
item.description: Learn everyday Japanese conversation with JapanesePod101.com! You’ve been living in a Japanese guesthouse for over a month now, and while you like it, it’s a bit expensive and you’d prefer your own space. So you decide to go to a Japanese real estate agent to see what’s available. But as soon as you look at [...]
